body: @JapBoi I disagree because she only wanted sex and nothing more at first, with that setting it has a much bigger impact when she falls for him and it turns out to be one sided.
I thinks she knows the guy doesn't love her back that's why she let him go.

'https://discord.gg/Mp4hWGD5cf
Bruh:aLjaA
And I’m deep into the degenerate route, so I’ve read a LOT of hentai XD

I think the story is great as it is too, but once I try and switch from hentai-reading mode to purely story-appreciation mode, problems arise in the whole situation being kinda weird. I like romance stories and so I look most at the romance aspects, and somebody asking a person they barely know for sex isn’t very... romantic 😅. Maybe for people that have different perspectives, the sex doesn’t bother them. But I would like them to go through at least a date or two instead of immediately sex. Afterwards, they could have as much sex as they want. It could be a whole series with them having sex every chapter, and as long as there’s still sufficient space allocated to plot development, I would definitely read it. But another reason I said this should be made a non-hentai is because that way more people will read it, and I want a lot of people to read this. It might be weird that I was so moved by a short hentai but it was touching. I’ve never read a hentai with such a great bittersweet end

The plot is excellent as it is JapBoi. Sex scenes add to intensity and make it more genuine. Without them this wiouldn't be nearly as bittersweet as it is. Wish it had an english or nihngo version so I could read what he said to get her so upset in panel 9.

Like @Nice0506 mentioned, she might have stopped herself because she didn’t think she could stop him; she might have not wanted to burden him with a choice like that; she might have been afraid of being rejected. Or there might have been another reason. Anyways, I really think with a similar basic plot with some changes, this would make for an excellent manga

(Continuation of previous comment)
with his family and friends who have all passed away. She agrees on the condition that he grants her a wish each time she wins, and these wishes are sex, as she takes a liking to him. (This is where I feel could be changed to non-hentai manga; she could ask for things like going on a date with him, and this would add up to enough for at least a short story) As she spends more and more time with him, she can be seen growing more and more attracted to him.  But simultaneously, he gets better and better with each match, and despite her best efforts, she can feel that the day he manages a game over her is nearing.  One of these days, she begins to ask him “What if...” but stops herself.  And soon after, he manages to best her. He leaves after what she notes as a brief farewell.  She then finally asks: “What if I had asked you to stay?  What would you have done?”

Honestly, this was such a good and also sad story.  I legit think the author should have made a non-hentai manga with the same plot; I definitely would read it.  Basically, the guy had liked tennis but he was bad at it, and out of frustration he gave up on the sport pretty early on, so he never had intensely practiced for a long period of time.  But after death, he became a spirit bound to the world by his unsatisfied dream of winning a game of the sport he loved.

However, as can be seen in one of the pages, the manga is set in a near-apocalyptic future where water levels have risen to levels that sink buildings.  In such dire times, and with little land to play on, sports naturally fell out of favor, and the guy had difficulty finding any tennis courts, let alone a person who played tennis who he could go against to satisfy his dream.

And he finally met the girl, who he asked to hold a match with him to help him complete his dream and finally leave this world, and be reunited
so sad TAT
Thank you for story man! @Nice0506
